name: Deed and Viper: Staff Onboarding - General User

items.instruction: Create a mailbox in local exchange

description.content: To create a mailbox, login to [Exchange admin center](https://webmail.mondiale.co.nz/ecp/?ExchClientVer=15)   and create a user mailbox.

Please ensure that the user does not have a license assigned on O365 until the migration is complete.
Once the mailbox is created on local Exchange, head to O365 Exchange Admin center using [these credentials](https://lancom.itglue.com/529117)

items.instruction: Find the account in office 365 and assign the appropriate license

description.content:
Generally, Exchange Online (Plan 1) for NZ users and M365 Business Standard for AU users.
Login to the account and test inbound and outbound emails.

items.instruction: !!!IMPORTANT!!! Enable MFA for the user account in Office 365.

description.content: YOU ARE NOT FINISHED UNTIL THE MFA is completed with the user
Login to MONDIT2 with a domain administrator account, and [follow this document](https://lancom.itglue.com/529117/docs/760450#version=published&documentMode=view)

Add the user to the "Citrix Delivery Group Access" if they need access to Citrix.
Log In to [this account](https://remote.mondiale.co.nz/) using Office 365 account of the user. Set up Outlook and test inbound and outbound emails. 

Run sign.exe from [mondiale.co.nz](http://mondiale.co.nz/)\Shares\emailsigs\ and check the user has email signature when writing new emails.

Open CAFS and make sure you can log in and open modules.

Open Doc Manager and make sure that loads.

Check printers and drives are mapped as required. 

Printing for Citrix Users: Printers are mapped by Citrix Print Policies. The groups that map these are under the Mondiale Citrix Servers OU. Add the relevant one if the user will be using Citrix.

If you need to change policies you can do this through Citrix Print Policies in GPO. You need to use MONDDC6 to see these policies under User Configuration/Citrix Policies

Mondiale does not use VOIP phones. Where the phones are patched in the server room will determine the extension it gets. The middle section in the patch panel lists the extensions. The sections to the left and right are the usual patch extensions that link back to ports around the building.
For more info [IT glue document available here](https://lancom.itglue.com/529117)

NOTE: User setup is not done till you have logged in to the actual PC they will use and set up outlook/signature, CAFS and doc manager shortcuts are on desktop and working and Zeacom is set up for their phone.
